newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-New South Wales govt critical of S&P visit.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-New South Wales govt critical of S&P visit.

text.p: The treasurer of the Australian state of New South Wales, Michael Egan, said on Tuesday a visit by state opposition leader Peter Collins to ratings agency Standard and Poors was an act of economic treason.

"The state opposition's visit today to the rating agency, Standard and Poors (S&P), to argue for a downgrading of the New South Wales credit rating is an act of economic treason," Egan said in a statement. However, S&P said there was nothing out of the ordinary in the meeting.

"As I understand there is a neeting that we're conducting with the New South Wales opposition, but it's not along those lines (to argue for a downgrade)," S&P Director Susan Shaw told Reuters. "It's really just to make contact with them, in the same we do with a number of parties in the market."
In May, S&P affirmed the state's AAA long term and A1-plus short term local currency ratings and said the ratings outlook was stable.
